title: Eerie moment man approaches girl, 3, who vanished 10 days ago
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Police hunting for missing toddler Kamille McKinney have released chilling video from the night she vanished.

In the CCTV, a man is seen approaching the missing girl, 3, as she plays with a friend outside her family’s housing complex.

The footage was recorded on the night investigators in Alabama, US, believe Kamille was abducted.

Kamille – known by her family as ‘Cupcake’ – hasn’t been seen since the evening of Saturday, 12 October.

Authorities believe she was abducted from the housing estate where she lives during a birthday party.

Her whereabouts are still unknown.

Kamille went missing during a birthday party 10 days ago (Picture: Facebook)

Two people arrested after she went missing deny any involvement in her disappearance.

Police released the new surveillance video to the public as lawyers for Patrick Devone Stallworth, 39, and Derick Irisha Brown, 29, separately denied their clients had anything to do with the abduction.

Stallworth’s lawyer, Emory Anthony, told a news conference: ‘We hope that the Birmingham Police Department will do everything with the FBI to find the child.

‘We hope the child is still alive and the child is doing well.’

In a statement, attorneys for Brown said she was ‘horrified’ by the girl’s disappearance but had no involvement.

Dominic Mckinney, Kamille’s father, said he would do anything to have his daughter back (Picture: Facebook)

Police say the new CCTV video shows a potential person of interest near to the abduction scene before Kamille disappeared.

The unidentified man is seen walking up to Kamille and another child who are playing outside before standing close to them and walking away, with the children following.

Police Chief Patrick Smith told a news conference he hopes someone may be able to identify the man or the other child who could help their investigations.

On Sunday, community volunteers joined a search for the missing girl in an area police believe was frequented by a person of interest in the case.

Last week, Kamille’s family endured more agony after hopes she had been found safe and well proved to be false.

Video released by police shows man approach Kamille and another child on the night of her abduction (Picture: Birmingham Police)

The man walks away with two children following (Picture: Birmingham Police)

She was reported to have been found at an apartment complex in Birmingham, Alabama, on Wednesday morning.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Local Sheriff Mark Pettway initially said that the three-year-old was discovered alive.

But Birmingham Police Department Sgt Johnny Williams then confirmed the reports were false and that Kamille is still missing.

Sgt Williams’ team is leading the investigation into Kamille’s disappearance and said confusion arose when the bounty hunter mistook another toddler living in the apartment complex for Kamille.

A huge crowd gathered and cheered at the news, causing confusion among the sheriff’s department.

Ambulances and police cars were called to the scene but later left.

description: He was filmed approaching missing toddler Kamille McKinney as she played with another child outside her home on the night she vanished.
